intro: Tragopogon pseudocastellanus, commonly known as the narrowleaf goat's beard, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and feathery leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in the summer, attracting various pollinators. Tragopogon pseudocastellanus is often found in association with other members of the genus, such as T. mirus and T. dubius.
